translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Chapter with Sumedhā
The Elder Nun Saṅkamanatthā’s Verses
“The Fortunate One Vipassī,🔽the world’s chief, the one of great patience,
was walking on the road,
delivering beings.🔽Having gone forth from the house,
I was lying down in a pit,
the compassionate protector of the world
stepped on my head.
Having stepped on my head,
the leader of the world went away,
and through that confidence in my mind,
I went to the Tusita heaven.
My defilements were burnt up,
I live without pollutants.
It was good for me,
I have done what the Awakened One said.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the nun Saṅkamanatthā recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ saṅkamanatthā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Saṅkamanatthātheriyāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam saṅkamanatthā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽saṅkamanattha atheriyā apadānam catuttha
translated: The Chapter with Saṅkamanatthā’s Verses is finished.
